DOCNAME: CASE OF IALAMOV v. THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was arrested on a charge of murder . Later he was also charged with several counts of theft .

CARDINAL . The applicant was held in pre - trial detention until DATE , when he was acquitted of the murder charges but convicted for theft and sentenced to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . In view of the duration of his pre - trial detention , he was immediately released .

CARDINAL . During the trial the applicant ’s detention was extended periodically . CARDINAL of the extensions concerned the period DATE . On DATE , DATE before the expiry of that period , the prosecutor in charge of the case applied for another extension . The applicant argued in his submissions , inter alia , that such an order was not allowed because the prosecutor had failed to comply with the provisions of LAW of LAW , that is that such an application had to be lodged at DATE before the expiry of the detention period . Nevertheless , the prosecutor ’s application was accepted by the court on CARDINAL DATE and the applicant ’s pre - trial detention was prolonged by DATE . An appeal by the applicant was later dismissed by ORG without any consideration being given to his argument set out above .
